question.text: Choose the correct option with respect to the genetic makeup of the ABO blood grouping system in humans.

solution.text: ABO blood group system is example of multiple allelism in which 3 alleles are there to control the blood group. These 3 alleles are A (Dominant),  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> (Dominant) and O (Recessive). This blood grouping has 4 types of phenotypes (as 4 blood groups) which are  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></math>  and  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> . This grouping has total 6 types of genotypes which are  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>  and  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></math> .
